answers.author: Mindy Manson
answers.text:
The City of Wylie uses the Nixle system for alerts.  We have been very pleased with it and use it for multiple purposes - community events, traffic, weather, closures, etc.  The messages are delivered via text message and e-mail.

Aspen and Pitkin County has a feature like this. You can see the information at http://pitkinalert.org/index.php?CCheck=1
It permits you to receive the information via email or telephone (wireless or landline). There are many providers of this service now.

author: Larry Paine
text: I know that some communities are using email newsletters to community members.  Are there any providers that use text messaging subscriptions to notify the community about urgent or emergency situations.  Example would be: Due to rain all rec games are postponed or Main street closed dut to water main break--road closed.
title: Electronic Community Contacts
